page.title: 10THE CORN EXCHANGE, NEWBURY.
page.content: The Corn Exchange was built in 1862 in the Market Place. There are many things going on there. Twice a year there is an Operatic Society performance at Easter and Christmas.Concerts of all kinds are given by local schoolchildren and orchestras.There are nights for young people to learn to roller skate and sometimes there is ice skating on artificial ice. There are opportunities to buy at craft fairs, charity bazaars and antique fairs which are held on some Saturdays and Sundays.It is also a centre for people who wish to donate blood.
